availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Pennsylvania or Virginia native. Son of Elisha Cravens and Sarah Dawkins Cravens. Married to Elizabeth Dawkins Cravens. Father of Mary W. Cravens, John Cravens, Clifton Cravens, and Clarissa Cravens. Farmer in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 386A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 249.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 179A.
Daughters of the American Revolution, Lineage Book, Volume 139, (Washington, D.C.: Press of Judd and Detweiler, Inc., 1934), 159.
Kentucky Historical Society, Kentucky Cemetery Records Project: Henry County, Kentucky, Volume 1, (Frankfort, KY: Kentucky Historical Society, 1986).
